importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most recent update to the ALCS outcome and the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series, marking a significant moment in the 2025 MLB postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The ALCS Game 7 took place on the evening of October 20, 2025, placing this event within the immediate context of the 2025 MLB postseason and marking the culmination of a dramatic playoff series.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series to advance to their first World Series since 1993.
George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning, which was pivotal in turning the game around and securing the victory.

The game was marked by controversy involving a disputed play where Julio Rodriguez reached first base after a ricochet off Daulton Varsho's helmet, later ruled a violation due to deliberate obstruction.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP after a stellar performance with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.
The Blue Jays will host the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 of the World Series on Friday, October 24, 2025.
The Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to have appeared in a World Series, making their elimination a historic milestone.

George Springer, who previously won the World Series MVP in 2017 with the Houston Astros, returned to form after being sidelined due to a pitch to the knee in Game 5, demonstrating resilience and dedication to the team and fans.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodriguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodriguez opened the game with a double and hit a solo home run in the third inning, contributing significantly to the Mariners’ early lead in Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Cal Raleigh
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Raleigh, a top home run hitter during the regular season, hit a fifth long ball in the playoffs, extending the Mariners' lead during the game.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bazardo was the pitcher facing George Springer in the pivotal seventh-inning at-bat, where Springer hit the game-winning home run.

namedEntities.name: Shane Bieber
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bieber was the pitcher who gave up a solo home run to Julio Rodriguez in the third inning, contributing to the Mariners’ scoring in the game.

namedEntities.name: Chris Bassitt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bassitt pitched a scoreless eighth inning in the game, helping to preserve the Blue Jays’ lead and contribute to the final outcome.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman closed the game in the ninth inning with a perfect inning, striking out all three batters to seal the victory.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Varsho hit a soft groundball single in the bottom of the first inning to tie the game 1-1, setting the tone for the Blue Jays’ momentum.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, advancing to their first World Series since 1993. The pivotal moment came when George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning, turning the game around after being trailing. The game featured a controversial play where Julio Rodriguez reached first base after a ricochet off Daulton Varsho’s helmet, later ruled a violation due to deliberate obstruction. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP for his outstanding performance, including a .385 batting average and three home runs. The Blue Jays will host the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, marking a historic moment for the franchise and a major event in MLB postseason history, especially as the Mariners remain the only MLB team never to reach a World Series.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
